intro: Jatropha websteri, commonly known as the Webster's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic members. Jatropha websteri thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its growth pattern includes both upright and creeping forms, depending on environmental factors.
